messages: 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:01): (Also, is it the latest version of html5lib?)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:01): I just did an svn up
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (18:03): Title: MySpace.com - Paris Hilton - 27 - Female - California - www.myspace.com/parishilton (at www.myspace.com)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:04): with --no-html it works, but it's considerably less useful. ;-)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:04): I think liberalxmlparser is known to not work
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:04): but I don't know why -x activates that

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (18:06): bugmail: "[Bug 6389] New: Avoid double parse error on EOF in DOCTYPE state" ( message in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Jan/0012.html>

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:06): jgraham: or someone else: Would it seem sensible to make -x just output XML like it says, and add a new option like --liberal-xml-parser to use the liberal XML parser?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:18): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: If you svn up and run that command again, it'll use the proper HTML5 parser and then serialise as XML
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:18): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: (I'm assuming that you do actually want the proper HTML5 parser, not its liberal XML parser)

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:19): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: But you won't get an xmlns="http://blahblah/xhtml" on the output, if the input didn't have that, which I hope you won't mind too much
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:19): and if you do mind, you should ask someone to fix html5lib's XML serialiser :-)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:20): I might be able to fix it as well as anybody else... but in this case, I think the guy who I'm helping just needs a SAX interface to myspace data
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:20): so the xmlns is prolly not a deal-breaker
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:21): (In particular, it's the serialiser in simpletree.py's toxml)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:22): oh right... RDFa ... that's what brought this up in the 1st place.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:23): "http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/PR-rdf-schema-19990303#" that's an unfortunate URI to get hard-coded as URI-as-identifier...
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (18:23): Title: Resource Description Framework (RDF) Schema Specification (at www.w3.org)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:23): Oh, if the input has got anything that parses into a DOM that cannot be dumbly serialised into well-formed XML, then parse.py is going to work pretty badly
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:24): yeah, the RDF schema URI was one of the 1st ones minted; we didn't have a good feel for the trade-offs
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:25): that one doesn't look right, to me
